item.title: How to avoid PyBind11 and write 5x faster CPython bindings 🐍
item.description: Python’s not the fastest language out there. Developers often use tools like Boost.Python and SWIG to wrap faster native C/C++ code for Python. PyBind11 is the most popular tool for the job not the quickest. NanoBind offers improvements, but when speed really matters, we turn to pure CPython C API bindings. With StringZilla, I started with PyBind11 but switched to CPython to reduce latency. The switch did demand more coding effort, moving from modern C++17 to more basic C99, but the result is a 5x lower call latency!
item.author: (Ash Vardanian)
